MINUTE ENTRY RE: STATUS CONFERENCE RE: MOTIONS TO BE HEARD ON 10/8/09 HELD. Mr. Davidson advised that the parties would be submitting stipulated orders prohibiting use of cash collateral in each of the four related cases; he will be filing motions for use of cash collateral and will be withdrawing his motions to consolidate in each of the four cases. The Court will hear debtors' motions for cash collateral on October 27, 2009 at 9:00 a.m. at the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Spokane. As regards the motions for stay relief presently set for hearing on October 8, 2009 and the motion for relief from stay by American Honda Finance now set for October 15, 2009, those motions will be set for final evidentiary hearing on October 27, 2009 at 9:00 a.m. in Spokane; a status hearing will be held on October 22, 2009 at 1:30 p.m. by telephone conference call to (509) 353-3192; on or before that status hearing the parties will exchange exhibit lists and exhibits and will attempt to stipulate to the exhibits if possible; Mr. Davidson will communicate with Mr. Lyman and Mr. Farrell regarding his responsive pleadings to their motions. He will also be filing the schedules on or before October 9, 2009. Mr. Davidson's application to approve employment will be set on October 15, 2009 at 11:00 a.m. by telephone conference call to (509) 353-3192. (MAS) (Entered: 10/07/2009)

MINUTE ENTRY RE: STATUS CONFERENCE RE: MOTIONS TO BE HEARD ON 10/27/09 IN SPOKANE VACATED: Per hearing on 10/19/09, a hearing will be held on 10/21/09 at 4:00 p.m. regarding the 2004 exam issues, and the rescheduling of the evidentiary hearing on motions for dismissal and stay relief. (MAS) (Entered: 10/19/2009)

MINUTE ENTRY RE: FINAL HEARING ON MOTION FOR RELIEF FROM STAY - SPOKANE VACATED: Evidentiary hearing stricken at this time and will be rescheduled at the hearing to be held on 10/21/09 at 4:00 p.m. (MAS) (Entered: 10/19/2009)

MINUTE ENTRY RE: STATUS CONFERENCE RE: EVIDENTIARY HEARING ON 10/27/09 HELD. Counsel for creditors express concern about the late-filed schedules; debtors express concern about the scheduled 2004 exam; After discussion among all, the parties have agreed to continue the evidentiary hearing on stay relief and dismissal presently set on October 27, 2009 in Spokane to a time to be set at a hearing on October 21, 2009 at 4:00 p.m. by telephone conference. At the hearing on October 21, 2009, the parties will submit an order on 2004 exam, which order shall direct debtors to appear and produce specific documents indentified by the creditors. Court will review the proposed order and the scope of documents requested. Mr. Davidson informs Court and counsel that he will not be filing a motion for use of cash collateral at this time, but may file an emergency motion at a later date. Court will strike the status hearing presently set on October 22, 2009. (MAS) (Entered: 10/19/2009)

MINUTE ENTRY RE: HEARING RE: 2004 EXAM, RESCHEDULING EVIDENTIARY HEARING ON MOTIONS FOR DISMISSAL & STAY RELIEF HELD. Counsel and Court discuss the list of items to be produced for the 2004 exam; Mr. Davidson advises that the parties have come to an agreement with the exception of #15. After discussion, Item #15 will be deleted. Mr. Davidson indicates that additional materials will be forthcoming to the parties; Mr. Hames and Mr. Davidson will confer regarding GE's list of requested documents and will incorporate their agreed language in the order. Counsel discuss the location of the 2004 exam; Counsel agree that Jennifer Shumate does not need to appear at this time, but may be called at a later date. The parties will exchange witness lists on or before October 28, 2009; exhibits will be exchanged by November 3, 2009; a status conference will be held on November 5, 2009 at 10:00 a.m. by parties calling (509) 353-3192; the evidentiary hearing will be held in Spokane, Washington on commencing at 10:00 a.m. on November 9, 2009 and may possibly carry over to November 10, 2009. The first matter to be dealt with at the evidentiary hearing will be the motions to dismiss/convert followed by the various motions for relief from stay. The Court will enter its Order. (MAS) (Entered: 10/22/2009)

MINUTE ENTRY RE: STATUS RE: EXHIBIT LISTS AND RELATED MATTERS PER SCHEDULING ORDER HELD. Counsel and Court discuss the discovery that remains to be completed prior to the in-court hearing on November 9, 2009; Court inquires as to the appraisal testimony, and need for any additional depositions. Creditors GE Commercial Distribution Corporation, American Honda Finance Corporation, Harley-Davidson Credit Corporation and Kawasaki Motor Finance's Motions for Relief From Stay will go forward on Monday, November 9, 2009 commencing at 10:00 a.m. Debtors' cases will then proceed following presentation of Creditors' cases. In the event the matters are not concluded on November 9 and 10th, they will be continued to another date. Court will require the exhibits to be exchanged by 5:00 p.m., on Thursday, November 5, 2009; The status conference presently set on November 5, 2009 at 10:00 a.m., is continued to Friday, November 6, 2009 at 10:00 a.m. As to Harley Davidson Credit Corporation's motion to dismiss, the Court will reschedule that matter on Tuesday, November 10, 2009. Mr. Schneider may bring up the renoting of his motion regarding bifurcation of priorities of creditors to the Court on Tuesday, November 10, 2009. Court will enter its Order. (MAS) (Entered: 11/04/2009)
